sentences.en: Anne was eager to obliterate her error.
sentences.cn: 安妮极想忘却她的错误.

sentences.en: But in China you not only hide them but also obliterate all facts about such aspects.
sentences.cn: 但在中国,你们不仅把他们藏起来,而且掩盖任何这种情况的事实.

sentences.en: Collisions with small space flotsam can obliterate a ship.
sentences.cn: 与太空中很小的漂浮物的碰撞可能完全摧毁一艘飞船.

sentences.en: Effective encoding technologies to obliterate redundance and retain the image quality are the focus of research.
sentences.cn: 采用有效的压缩编码技术删除冗余,以尽量少的比特数存储图像,并同时保证图像的质量,己成为研究的热点.

sentences.en: However, obliterate should never be used to delete actual work.
sentences.cn: 当然, 删除应该决不用于删除真正的工作.

sentences.en: Little things brought out on such occasions need great love to obliterate them afterward.
sentences.cn: 在这类情况下产生的小摩擦,需要伟大的爱情事后来消除.

sentences.en: Nothing could obliterate the memory of those tragic events.
sentences.cn: 那些悲惨事件的记忆是无法抹去的。

sentences.en: Now, he can obliterate an opponent from a great distance.
sentences.cn: 现在, 他能在很远的距离上就除去对手.

sentences.en: Obliterate is for situations where something in the repository should never have been there at all.
sentences.cn: 删除是为了一些在库中根本不需要的.

sentences.en: Subfreezing temperatures obliterate these vessels and this leads to tumor destruction by devascularization.
sentences.cn: 这些脉管会由于低温而收缩,使肿瘤因血供应阻断而消灭.

sentences.en: The Great Anunnaki obliterate Agade. Inanna escapes.
sentences.cn: 伟大的安奴拿其使 阿卡 德湮没,伊娜娜逃走.

sentences.en: Their warheads are enough to obliterate the world several times over.
sentences.cn: 他们拥有的弹头足以将世界毁灭好几次。

sentences.en: There was time enough to obliterate memories of how things once were for him.
sentences.cn: 有足够的时间来抹掉他对过去的记忆。

sentences.en: Would you like to obliterate the letters in margin of the page by the altering water?
sentences.cn: 你能用涂改液涂去这一页边上的这些字母 吗 ?

trans.tran_cn: 涂去, 删除, 使湮没
trans.tran_en: If you obliterate something such as a memory, emotion, or thought, you remove it completely from your mind

trans.tran_cn: 涂去，擦掉，使消失，使被忘却，忘掉
trans.tran_en: to remove a thought, feeling, or memory from someone’s mind
